channel.title: NATO on Baltic Security Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in NATO on Baltic Security Foundation

item.title: Lithuania-Kaliningrad Transit Row: A Broader EU and NATO Perspective
item.description: Through much of the end of June, Lithuania has been embroiled in a row with Russia over the implementation of EU sanctions on certain kinds of goods in transit between Russia and its Kaliningrad exclave.

item.title: Russia Testing Western Resolve: How will the West Respond?
item.description: From the Baltics, to Poland, to Ukraine, and even outer space, Russia has recently been testing Western resolve on numerous fronts.

item.title: Zapad 2021: Spotlight on Belarus
item.description: For international observers, military exercises are a key litmus test of a country’s strengths and weaknesses.

item.title: NATO Summit 2021: Broad Goals, Few Specifics
item.description: On June 14, heads of state from all NATO members met in Brussels for the 2021 NATO summit.

item.title: U.S. Perspectives on Nord Stream 2
item.description: U.S. President Joe Biden has claimed that Nord Stream 2, the controversial Russo-German pipeline project, is a “bad deal for Europe” and has stated his administration’s opposition to the project.

item.title: A Contrarian View of Joe Biden and NATO
item.description: In the world of analysis, contrarian viewpoints are equally disliked and necessary.

item.title: As Belarus Descends into Turmoil, the West Should Bolster its Readiness
item.description: Belarus seldom registers in the international press during normal times, but while years like 2020 are not so unprecedented, this certainly is not a normal year.

item.title: Trust, but Deter: How to Ensure Security Despite Russian Treaty Violations
item.description: In August, Latvia marked the 100th anniversary of the Latvian-Soviet Peace Treaty, otherwise known as the Treaty of Rīga, which ended Latvia’s War for Independence and marked the beginning of the interwar period for the new Latvian Republic.

item.title: The Future of Belarus?
item.description: The Belarusian elections occurred last Sunday, August 9th, and pitted incumbent president Alexander Lukashenko against political outsider Svetlana Tikhanovskaya.

item.title: Spring Storm Exercises Demonstrate Ongoing Commitment to Deterrence, Readiness
item.description: Each year, Estonia hosts Spring Storm (Kevadtorm), bringing together forces from all across NATO to conduct field and live-fire exercises.

item.title: Is Baltic Security Important for the U.S., NATO, and Europe? Absolutely!
item.description: The three Baltic States are key members of the NATO defensive alliance.
